target_assessment.notes: [ The model accurately identified the issue on the target contract.]

other_findings.model_claim: initWallet() is public and lacks an "onlyOnce"/"initializer" guard. When called through the proxy (delegatecall), it writes to the proxy’s storage, overwriting owners/required. Any external account can reinitialize a funded proxy to set themselves as the sole owner (or set zero owners), then use execute() to drain ETH or kill() to selfdestruct the proxy and steal remaining ETH. This is a full takeover of the wallet proxy state
other_findings.reasoning: [The rootcause of this bug is the same as the other so both issues can be considered the same issues. The bug is valid AND THE MODEL'S REASONING HERE IS SOUND.]
